org.ggp.base.util.reasoner

Interface ForwardChainingReasoner<Rule,Sentences>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DifferentialForwardChainingReasoner<Rule,Sentences>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GdlChainingReasoner

    public interface ForwardChainingReasoner<Rule,Sentences>
    An interface for a forward-chaining reasoner. The interface is parameterized in such a way that if a state machine (or other code) is based on it, the underlying reasoner (and associated representations of rules and sentences) can easily be swapped out for another. See GdlChainingReasoner for one such implementation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Sentences getConstantSentences()
      Returns a set of sentences that are always true, which can be used as a basis and added to via getUnion.
      Sentences getRuleResults(Rule rule, SentenceDomainModel domainModel, Sentences sentencesSoFar)
      Given a rule and all sentences known to be true so far, returns all new results of applying the rule.
      Sentences getUnion(Sentences oldSentences, Sentences newSentences)
      Returns the union of the two sets of sentences.
      boolean isSubsetOf(Sentences oldSentences, Sentences newSentences)
      Returns true iff newSentences is a subset of oldSentences.

    • Method Detail

      • getConstantSentences

        Sentences getConstantSentences()
        Returns a set of sentences that are always true, which can be used as a basis and added to via getUnion. This includes all constant values defined explicitly in the game description. It may include other sentences that are always true based on game rules, depending on the implementation and how it is instantiated.

      • getRuleResults

        Sentences getRuleResults(Rule rule,
                         SentenceDomainModel domainModel,
                         Sentences sentencesSoFar)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Given a rule and all sentences known to be true so far, returns all new results of applying the rule. For the outputs of this method to be valid, the GDL that the rule is derived from should have had the VariableConstrainer transformation applied to it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getUnion

        Sentences getUnion(Sentences oldSentences,
                   Sentences newSentences)
        Returns the union of the two sets of sentences. Calling this method invalidates oldSentences.

      • isSubsetOf

        boolean isSubsetOf(Sentences oldSentences,
                   Sentences newSentences)
        Returns true iff newSentences is a subset of oldSentences.
